svg.font-family: SauceCodePro Nerd Font, Source Code Pro, Courier

g.text: A template for quickly building login systems on top of Node.js; a fork of
for the allowable options of the verbs.
Millisecond duration for attempting to send emails. Defaults to
Email site URL. Base URL added within password reset and
Locale for server log messages; defaults to "en-US".
Whether to disable logging; defaults to `false` (logging is
Database user; only needed with env=production
Database password; only needed with env=production
Current working directory; used with `--config`; defaults to
Not normally needed; used to point to instrumented path. Defaults
Points to a base path for finding locales. Defaults to
`app/server`. Only needed if overriding built-in locales.
Points to a path or URL to which to redirect after users
successfully log in. Defaults to `/home` (or locale equivalent).
Note that if you are overriding this option, you should provide
another means to your users to visit `/home`, e.g., through the
accessibility-recommended approach of having a site-wide
navigation bar, so as to allow your users to update or delete
their accounts. Note that this option will be overridden by any
`redirect` query parameter present in the URL.
A convenience to allow overriding the default route name per
path to `/updateAccount` for the `en-US` locale. If present, this
will take precedence over the routes in `localesBasePath`.
Whether to allow cross-domain redirects (for some values set by
`customRoute`). Note that the very old Firefox 2 will not be able
to make cross-domain redirects regardless of this setting, so it
will always use the (safe) locale redirect.
Path to a Node file that will be required. The file must have a
`module.exports` default function export that accepts the template
options (_, jml, baseurl, name, user, passKey, fromText,
Path to a Node file that will be required. The file must have a
`module.exports` default function export that accepts the template
options (_, jml, baseurl, name, user, activationCode, fromText,
Whether to require a name (separate from user name, as in a real
Point to absolute path at which to serve static files on the same
server. Multiple allowed. Not required. To require serving within
a particular non-root path, use `router` with Express' `app.get()`
Path to a Node file that will be required. The file must have a
`module.exports` default function export that will be passed the
resolved options. Multiple allowed. Not required. To require
serving within a particular non-root path, use `router` with
Path to a Node file that will be required. The file must have a
`module.exports` default function export that will be passed the
Express `app` instance and resolved options. Not required.
Mainly for easier debugging. Whether to use browser ESM source
modules where available in place of compiled IIFE code. Defaults
Whether to drop the core-js polyfills for compatibility with older
Path to a Node file that will be required. The file must have a
`module.exports` default function export that will be passed a
config object, including a `template` string indicating the
template being built. Must return an object with any of 4 optional
which should either be an HTML string or an array of Jamilih
children to be appended at the given position (or return an empty
array to add nothing). Not required.
Used to set config; when `cwd` is set, defaults to
"<cwd>/nogin.json"; of lower priority than other CLI arguments;
may also be a JavaScript file (nogin.js).
Two-letter country codes as JSON array; defaults to codes in
The database adapter to use. Defaults to "mongodb", the only
The path to a favicon; defaults to blank.
The path to a custom CSS stylesheet; defaults to no extra
Whether to suppress addition of built-in stylesheets, Bootstrap,
and gh-fork-ribbon.css. Defaults to `false`, i.e., built-in
Regular client-side JavaScript file to load after other scripts
ESM client-side JavaScript file to load after other scripts (none
Whether to load framework scripts locally instead of via CDN.
Person's name to include as from text in email notifications
URL of person to include as link on from text in email
Whether to host coverage within `/coverage`; defaults to `false`.
Whether to show the `/users` page. Off by default for privacy.
(May be removed as an option in the future if privileges are
Used for mitigating DoS attacks; defaults to 100
Disable Cross-site Resource Forgery checking. This setting should
Disable helmet use entirely. Off by default.
Options to be supplied to helmet. Defaults to `\u007bframeguard:
Options to be supplied to csurf. Defaults to `\u007bcookie:
\u007bsigned: true, sameSite: "lax"\u007d`; you may wish to add
`secure: true` to the `cookie` if serving on HTTPS.
Options to be supplied to `cookie` of `express-session`.Defaults
Options to be supplied to `express-session`.Defaults to
